title: Iwo Jima
summary: Iwo Jima (/ˌiːwoʊ ˈdʒiːmə/, also US: /ˌiːwə ˈ-/),[2][3][4][5] known in Japan as Iō Tō (硫黄島, Iō-tō, lit. '"sulfur island"'),[6] is one of the Japanese Volcano Islands and lies south of the Bonin Islands. Together with other islands, they form the Ogasawara Archipelago. The highest point of Iwo Jima is Mount Suribachi at 169 m (554 ft) high.
